intro: Schizanthus porrigens, commonly known as the "Mexican sweet pea," is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trailing stems that produce clusters of five-petaled blossoms in shades of pink, red, and white. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, dark green leaves, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Schizanthus porrigens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its beauty and ease of care.
